intro: Hebecladus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
